Name: Los Angeles Rapid Response Network
Organization Mission: The Los Angeles Raids Rapid Response Network is a collaborative effort between the community, faith, immigrant, labor, legal and LGBTQI organizations to protect, defend and serve the immigrant community of Los Angeles County from deportation. The RRRN was first established in 2006 as a response to mass raids in Los Angeles factories and textile centers. Today, the RRRN focuses on advocacy, direct action to shut down detention centers, and connecting immigrants facing detention and deportation to legal representation.

Name: Immigrant Rapid Response Hotline
Area: Santa Barbara, Ventura & San Luis Obispo
